intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Stand beside my horse, milady. She'll shelter you from the wind.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Yes, the Longfort. It stretches along the border of Ylisse and Regna Ferox.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: The khans that rule Ferox have grown quite wary of foreigners. Still, don't mistake a lack of hospitality for open hostility. This simply calls for a bit of diplomacy.

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Negotiation's not my strong suit, but I'll do my best. Remember, everyone: your actions here reflect back upon Ylisse.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Trouble in the wind, milord: the Feroxi Guard are mobilizing.

intro.speaker: Frederick
intro.line: Who can say? But they look ready to let fly at a moment's notice. We'd best prepare for combat, just to be safe. Perhaps we ought pool our supplies and select which Shepherds to deploy? Loath as I am to trust him/her, Robin might offer some valuable insight in this…

intro.speaker: Chrom
intro.line: Indeed, he/she IS our tactician, after all. So, Robin? What do you suggest?

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: I've been thinking about how you rode with Sumia earlier... Do our unit always have to fight one-on-one?

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: Are you suggesting we pair up? That's an interesting thought... I admit, I'd resemble a pincushion right now if it weren't for Sumia and her mount.

battle.speaker: Robin
battle.line: Exactly. By pairing up, units could lend each other added offense and defense... It might also allow quicker soldiers to ferry slower units great distances... Yes... Yes! I'm sure of it. This opens up all sorts of strategic possibilities! We should try it whenever the opportunity presents itself.

battle.speaker: Kellam
battle.line: *Sigh* Do they STILL not see me? Perhaps Chrom will talk to me if I...wave my...hands around...

battle.speaker: Chrom
battle.line: It already feels as though Robin has been a Shepherd forever. It's funny how fighting alongside someone speeds friendships along... And the more we fight side by side, the more valuable those friendships become!

battle.speaker: Frederick
battle.line: A key! We can use it to open the fortress doors.

cutscene.speaker: Sumia
cutscene.line: Better hold on tight, Captain. Could get bumpy.

cutscene.speaker: Sumia
cutscene.line: Oh, Captain, I'm so relieved I made it in time.

cutscene.speaker: Chrom
cutscene.line: That goes double for me, Sumia! And this—is this the same ornery pegasus we met on the road?!

cutscene.speaker: Sumia
cutscene.line: Oh, she's a sweetheart, isn't she? ...Once you really get to know her…

cutscene.speaker: Chrom
cutscene.line: Well, many thanks to you both.

cutscene.speaker: Lissa
cutscene.line: I think the pegasus is blushing!

cutscene.speaker: Frederick
cutscene.line: And I think we had all best focus on the situation at hand!

cutscene.speaker: Chrom
cutscene.line: All right. The Feroxi way it is!

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Why do I feel like I'm being watched...?

recruit-talk.speaker: Kellam
recruit-talk.line: I'm standing in plain sight, sir. Right he—

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: BWAAAH! Oh! I-is that you, Kellam? When did you arrive?

recruit-talk.speaker: Kellam
recruit-talk.line: ...The same time as you. I've been with you all along. Er, I AM still a Shepherd, right? It's quite the honor, after all. I'd hate to lose it. Sometimes I—

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: Of course, Kellam. Forgive me. You're just so...quiet, I completely—

recruit-talk.speaker: Kellam
recruit-talk.line: Quite all right, sir, quite all right. I've been told I'm easy to miss.

recruit-talk.speaker: Chrom
recruit-talk.line: At least the Feroxi didn't find you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Kellam
recruit-talk.line: I've been calling to you and waving my arms for several minutes... I don't think they've so much as glanced this way.

recruit-talk.speaker: Kellam
recruit-talk.line: Well, I just... I'm glad you finally saw me! Just try to keep an eye out from now on?

boss.speaker: Raimi
boss.line: Let our battle sound out the truth of your words!

end.speaker: Raimi
end.line: A thousand apologies, Prince Chrom. I truly took you for brigand impostors. But no frauds could ever wage a battle as you just have! I will send word of your arrival to the capital and escort you there personally.

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: That would be most appreciated, thank you.

end.speaker: Frederick
end.line: In Ferox, strength speaks louder than words. I should have known better than to overestimate the value of diplomacy here…

end.speaker: Lissa
end.line: So can we get going, Chrom?

end.speaker: Chrom
end.line: Yes, it's not getting any warmer.
